<small>Also see: **<big>[[H4974|מְתֹם]]</big>**</small>

 [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מַת‎</span>] **noun masculine** ==male, man== (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְתוּֿ‎</span> in proper name; Zinjirli <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מת‎</span> collective ***males, male offspring***; Assyrian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***mutu***</u></abbr>, ***husband***; Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***id.***; compare Egyptian <abbr title="transliteration"><u>***m-t***</u></abbr>, ***phallus, male***, [[BDB#Steind|Steind]] in [[BDB#Ba|Ba]]<sup>NB § 2b</sup>, <span class="bdbLangGreek">δ</span>); — only plural <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְתִים‎</span> [[Job.11.3|Job 11:3]] + 3 t., <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְתִם‎</span> [[Deut.2.34|Deut 2:34]]; [[Deut.3.6|Deut 3:6]] + [[Judg.20.48|Judg 20:48]] (probably), for [[BDB#MT|ᵑ0]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְתֹם‎</span>, so [[BDB#GFM|GFM]]; construct <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְתֵי‎</span> [[Gen.34.30|Gen 34:30]] + 13 t.; suffix 2 feminine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְתַיִךְ‎</span>; [[Isa.3.25|Isa 3:25]] 3 masculine singular <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְתָיו‎</span> [[Deut.33.6|Deut 33:6]] — 

**1.** ***males, men***, [[Isa.3.25|Isa 3:25]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎גְּבוּרָתֵךְ‎</span>); more distinctly, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וְהַטָּף‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎(וְ)הַנָּשִׁים‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְתִם‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎עִיר‎</span> [[Deut.2.34|Deut 2:34]]; [[Deut.3.6|Deut 3:6]] every ***city of males*** (male population, compare [[BDB#Dr|Dr]]), ***and the women***, etc.; [[Judg.20.48|Judg 20:48]] (see above; opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בְּהֵמָה‎</span>). 

**2.** usually less emphasis on sex, in prose only phrase: 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְתֵי מִסְפָּר‎</span> ***men of number*** (numerable, i.e. few) [[Gen.34.30|Gen 34:30]] ([[BDB#J|J]]; apposition of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֲנִי‎</span> = Jacob, representing his family), [[Deut.4.27|Deut 4:27]]; [[Jer.44.28|Jer 44:28]], also [[Ps.105.12|Ps 105:12]] = [[1Chr.16.19|1Chr 16:19]] compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎וִיהִי מְתָיו מִסְפָּר‎</span> [[Deut.33.6|Deut 33:6]] ***and (but) let his men be few.*** 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בִּמְתֵי מְעָ֑ט‎</span> = ***consisting of a few men*** [[Deut.26.5|Deut 26:5]]; [[Deut.28.62|Deut 28:62]] 

**3.** elsewhere only in poetry, sex usually not emphasized: 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** [[Job.11.3|Job 11:3]]; [[Job.24.12|Job 24:12]]; [[Ps.17.14|Ps 17:14]] (twice in verse) (but text probably corrupt, of. [[BDB#Bae|Bae]] [[BDB#We|We]]; at least omit <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ממתים ידך‎</span> [[BDB#Ol|Ol]] [[BDB#Bi|Bi]] [[BDB#Che|Che]], compare [[BDB#Hup|Hup-Now]]); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְתֵי ישׂראל‎</span> [[Isa.41.14|Isa 41:14]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** poetic phrase: <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְתֵי שָׁוְא‎</span> ***men of false-hood*** [[Job.11.11|Job 11:11]]; [[Ps.26.4|Ps 26:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָוֶן‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> [[Ps.22.15|Ps 22:15]] ***men of wickedness***; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎סוֺדִי‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> [[Ps.19.19|Ps 19:19]] ***men of my cycle***; <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָהֳלִי‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> [[Job.31.31|Job 31:31]] ***men of my tent*** (household); <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎רָעָב‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מ‎</span> [[Isa.5.13|Isa 5:13]] ***men of hunger***, but read probably <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְזֵי ר‎</span> ***sucked out, empty*** from hunger (as [[Deut.32.24|Deut 32:24]]) [[BDB#Ew|Ew]] [[BDB#De|De]] [[BDB#Che|Che]] [[BDB#Di|Di]] [[BDB#Du|Du]] (compare <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָזֶה‎</span>).
